name: Firefox - Tab Close Button Enhancement
description: Makes the tiny, Close Tab button larger and easier to target.
additional_info:
The Close Tab button is a small target, and requires a fine mouse movement to click successfully.  

This userstyle makes the Close Tab button taller, wider, and touch the top of the screen, making it "infinitely tall" from the perspective of the mouse, as well as provide visual feedback when the mouse is in the target area.  Now a coarse movement is all that's required to close a tab with the mouse, hopefully, resulting in increased GUI usability.  (Requires the Menu Bar be hidden so that the Tab Bar is the topmost UI element in the Firefox parent window.)

Recommended configuration: 
- Best paired with the Custom Tab Width add-on, available here: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-us/firefox/addon/custom-tab-width/
- Once Custom Tab Width is installed, in your about:config, set your browser.tabs.tabMaxWidth to 2048
